meanings.definition: To separate the threads of (a woven or knitted fabric)
meanings.sent1: She unraveled the yarn to fix the mistake in her knitting.
meanings.sent2: The tailor unraveled the fabric to make alterations to the dress.
meanings.sent3: As she unraveled the scarf, she found a hidden message knitted into it.
meanings.sent4: The mystery of the missing sock was finally unraveled when she found it in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent5: The cat unraveled the ball of yarn, leaving a tangled mess on the floor.

meanings.definition: To investigate and solve or explain (something complicated or puzzling)
meanings.sent1: The detective unraveled the case and caught the thief.
meanings.sent2: She unraveled the riddle by carefully analyzing each clue.
meanings.sent3: The children unraveled the treasure map and set off on an adventure.
meanings.sent4: The scientist unraveled the mystery of the strange phenomenon with a groundbreaking discovery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher unraveled the confusing math problem to help the students understand it better.

meanings.sent1: The old rope unraveled as he pulled it, causing the package to fall.
meanings.sent2: Her hair unraveled from the bun as she danced energetically.
meanings.sent3: The kite unraveled from the string and flew away into the sky.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them slowly unraveled as misunderstandings piled up.
meanings.sent5: The plan unraveled when the main organizer fell ill, leaving everything in chaos.
